required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Magnetic Resonance Elastography of Cardiac Transplant Rejection
clinical_study.official_title: Magnetic Resonance Elastography of Cardiac Transplant Rejection

brief_summary.textblock: Magnetic Resonance Elastography (MRE) for cardiac transplant patients.

detailed_description.textblock: Patient will undergo MRE beginning 4-8 weeks post transplant, then with each scheduled cardiac biopsy through 7-8 months post transplant. Results of the MRE will be compared against results of the cardiac biopsy to determine if the non-invasive MRE can predict cardiac transplant rejection.

primary_outcome.measure: Cardiac Stiffness With Magnetic Resonance Elastography (MRE)
primary_outcome.description: MRE scans will be performed within 24-48 hours of standard of care cardiac biopsies for patients who have undergone cardiac transplant at The Ohio State University Ross Heart Hospital. Stiffness results from the MRE will be compared to histopathology from the cardiac biopsy to determine if the completely non-invasive MRE can successfully predict transplant rejection.

arm_group.description: Patients who have received a cardiac transplant at The Ohio State University Ross Heart Hospital will undergo Magnetic Resonance Elastography (MRE) (using a Magnetic Resonance Elastography driver) within 24-48 hours of standard of care biopsy. Results of both will be compared to determine if MRE can successfully predict cardiac transplant rejection.

intervention.description: A driver is required for MRE. The driver utilizes sound waves to produce vibrations. Images of these vibrations are captured with Magnetic Resonance scanner to produce images that indicate stiffness in an organ.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients must have undergone cardiac transplantation at the Ohio State University Ross Heart Hospital.
- Patients must be able to lie flat on their back in the scanner for up to 60 minutes
- Patient must be able to hold their breath for up to 15 seconds at a time.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who are claustrophobic
- Patients who are pregnant, due to potential risks to the fetus.
- Patients with any unapproved, non-MRI safe metal/devices in their bodies.

overall_official.affiliation: The Ohio State University Medical Center Dept. of Radiology

facility.name: The Ohio State University Medical Center

responsible_party.investigator_title: Professor and Chair, Department of Radiology

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Recruitment period: January 27, 2014 to December 7, 2014 (approximately 1 year) at The Ohio State University Wexner Medical Center.

The driver utilizes sound waves to produce vibrations. Images of these vibrations are captured with Magnetic Resonance scanner to produce images that indicate stiffness in an organ.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
